greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: mu(n!+1), where mu is the Moebius function (A008683).
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..139
Markus Tervooren et al., Factorization of n!+1, FactorDB.
formula: If n is in A064237, then a(n) = 0. Otherwise a(n) = (-1)^A054990(n) = (-1)^A066856(n). - _Max Alekseyev_, Oct 08 2019
example: a(6)=1 because 6!+1 = 721 = 7 * 103, the product of two different primes and thus mu(6!+1) = (-1)^2 = 1.
xref: Cf. A008683 (mu(n)), A054990 (bigomega(n!+1)), A066856 (omega(n!+1)), A064237 (n!+1 divisible by a square), A002981 (n!+1 is prime).
results.author: _Rick L. Shepherd_, Jun 10 2003
ext: a(112) corrected, a(113)-a(114) added by _Max Alekseyev_, May 28 2015
